title: N8N Automation Fundamentals
description: Master workflow automation with n8n from setup to building powerful workflows

challenges.title: Sign Up for N8N Cloud and Create First Workflow
challenges.description: Create your n8n cloud account and build your first automation workflow
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to sign up for n8n.cloud (free tier available), access their workspace, and create their first workflow. Explain the canvas, nodes, and connections.
hints: Go to https://n8n.cloud and sign up for free
Verify your email and log in
Create your first workflow from the dashboard
The canvas is where you build workflows
Nodes are the building blocks of automation

challenges.title: Understand Triggers and Nodes
challenges.description: Learn the difference between trigger nodes and action nodes
challenges.instructions: Teach the user about trigger nodes (start workflows) vs action nodes (perform tasks). Show common triggers like Manual, Schedule, and Webhook.
hints: Trigger nodes start the workflow execution
Action nodes perform operations (HTTP, Database, APIs)
Every workflow needs at least one trigger

challenges.title: Create a Schedule-Based Workflow
challenges.description: Build a workflow that runs automatically on a schedule
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to create a workflow with a Schedule trigger that runs at specific intervals. Add a simple action like sending data to a webhook or logging.
hints: Set interval (every hour, daily, custom cron)
Add an action node (HTTP Request or Set node)

challenges.title: Work with HTTP Requests
challenges.description: Master the HTTP Request node for API calls
challenges.instructions: Show the user how to use the HTTP Request node to fetch data from an API. Use a public API like JSONPlaceholder or a weather API.

challenges.title: Transform Data with Set Node
challenges.description: Learn to manipulate and transform data between nodes
challenges.instructions: Teach the user to use the Set node to extract, rename, or transform data fields from previous nodes. Show how to access data using expressions.
hints: Use 'Add Value' to create new fields

challenges.title: Implement Conditional Logic with IF Node
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to add an IF node to create conditional workflows. Show how to route data based on conditions (true/false branches).
hints: Set condition (equals, greater than, contains, etc.)
Add different actions for each branch
Test both paths with different data

challenges.title: Use Expressions and Functions
challenges.description: Master n8n's expression language for dynamic data
challenges.instructions: Teach the user to use expressions for dynamic values, date formatting, string manipulation, and math operations. Show the expression editor.

challenges.title: Build a Multi-Step Workflow
challenges.description: Create a complex workflow with multiple connected nodes
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to build a workflow that: fetches data from an API, filters/transforms it, applies conditional logic, and outputs results to multiple destinations.
hints: Start with Schedule or Webhook trigger
Add HTTP Request to fetch data
Use Set node to transform data

challenges.title: Handle Errors and Debugging
challenges.description: Learn to troubleshoot and handle workflow errors
challenges.instructions: Show the user how to debug workflows using node execution data, handle errors gracefully, and set up error workflows.
hints: Click on executed nodes to see input/output
Use 'Error Trigger' node for error handling
Use 'Stop and Error' node for testing

challenges.title: Connect Real Services (Gmail, Slack, etc.)
challenges.description: Integrate n8n with popular apps and services
challenges.instructions: Guide the user to connect n8n with real services like Gmail, Slack, Google Sheets, or Notion. Show OAuth setup and credential management.
hints: Add a service node (Gmail, Slack, etc.)
Build a real automation (e.g., email to Slack)

challenges.title: Use Webhooks for External Integration
challenges.description: Create webhook endpoints to receive data from external sources
challenges.instructions: Teach the user to set up webhook triggers, receive POST requests, and process incoming data from external applications. N8N Cloud provides publicly accessible webhook URLs automatically.
hints: Copy the production webhook URL (publicly accessible)
Test with curl, Postman, or external services
Process incoming data with subsequent nodes

challenges.title: Optimize Workflows with Loops and Batching
challenges.description: Handle large datasets efficiently with loops and batch processing
challenges.instructions: Show the user how to use loop nodes, split data into batches, and process large amounts of data without overwhelming APIs.
hints: Use 'Split In Batches' node for large datasets
Add 'Wait' node to avoid rate limits
